intro: Monopsis tenella, commonly known as the slender monopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellowish flowers appear in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Monopsis tenella is often found in shrubland and coastal habitats, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
